choices.E: The low cost of entry into cloud computing
choices.A: The speed at which AWS resources are implemented
choices.B: The speed at which AWS creates new AWS Regions

discussion.content: duplicate question 661

Selected Answer: AC
A. The speed at which AWS resources are implemented
C. The ability to experiment quickly

"Increase speed and agility – In a cloud computing environment, new IT resources are only a click away, which means that you reduce the time to make those resources available to your developers from weeks to just minutes. This results in a dramatic increase in agility for the organization, since the cost and time it takes to experiment and develop is significantly lower."

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

Selected Answer: CD
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/enterprise-strategy/the-seven-ss-of-organizational-agility/

Selected Answer: AC
A and C is the answer

Selected Answer: AC
A. The speed at which AWS resources are implemented

Selected Answer: AC
A. The speed at which AWS resources are implemented
C. The ability to experiment quickly

The concept of agility in AWS Cloud computing refers to the ability to quickly and easily deploy and manage resources on the AWS platform. This includes the speed at which AWS resources are implemented and the ability to experiment quickly with new services and features.

Selected Answer: AC
A. The speed at which AWS resources are implemented C. The ability to experiment quickly
A and C are the Answers obviously!
duplicat question - and the answears are A and C

questions.question_text: What does the concept of agility mean in AWS Cloud computing? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A. Security groups 
D. Network ACLs

below info for A. Security groups 
"When you create a VPC, it comes with a default security group. You can create additional security groups for each VPC."
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/vpc-security-groups.html

below info for D. Network ACLs
"A network access control list (ACL) allows or denies specific inbound or outbound traffic at the subnet level. You can use the default network ACL for your VPC, or you can create a custom network ACL for your VPC with rules that are similar to the rules for your security groups in order to add an additional layer of security to your VPC."
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/vpc-network-acls.html

Selected Answer: AD
AD is correct

Selected Answer: AD
AD for sure

Selected Answer: AD
Security Groups and Network ACLs are built in ways to control VPC's and their traffic both inbound and outbound.

questions.question_text: Which AWS services or features can control VPC traffic? (Choose two.)

A company wants to build an application for a new line of business.

According to the AWS Well-Architected Framework, what design principles should be implemented? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Design elasticity into the AWS Cloud design.
choices.D: Move on-premises network hardware to VPCs.
choices.C: Decouple the AWS Cloud architecture to break up monolithic deployments.
choices.A: Consolidate multiple AWS accounts into a single account.
choices.B: Buy and host hardware in the AWS Cloud.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
C. Decouple the AWS Cloud architecture to break up monolithic deployments.
E. Design elasticity into the AWS Cloud design.

Selected Answer: CE
The two correct items to choose are C and E. Decoupling the AWS cloud architecture to decompose monolithic deployments is a best practice that improves reliability, availability, and security, and simplifies management. Designing resiliency into your AWS cloud design can make you better resilient to change and improve reliability and availability.

1: AWS Best Practices: Decoupling AWS Cloud Architecture to Decompose Monoliths 
2: AWS Best Practices: Designing Elasticity into AWS Cloud Architectures

Selected Answer: AC
A. Consolidate multiple AWS accounts into a single account.
C. Decouple the AWS Cloud architecture to break up monolithic deployments.

According to the AWS Well-Architected Framework, the design principles that should be implemented when building an application for a new line of business include consolidating multiple AWS accounts into a single account and decoupling the AWS Cloud architecture to break up monolithic deployments.
A&C should be correct

Selected Answer: CE
C. Decouple the AWS Cloud architecture to break up monolithic deployments.
E. Design elasticity into the AWS Cloud design.
A&C is correct

Selected Answer: A
es difícil decidirse porque todos pueden llegar a cumplir la función que nos piden, pero la respuesta mas completa seria la A

Selected Answer: A
A. AWS WAF

"AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect web applications from attacks by allowing you to configure rules that allow, block, or monitor (count) web requests based on conditions that you define. These conditions include IP addresses, HTTP headers, HTTP body, URI strings, SQL injection and cross-site scripting."

https://aws.amazon.com/waf/faqs/

Selected Answer: A
AWS WAF
D is the right one

questions.question_text:
An application is receiving SQL injection attacks from multiple external resources.

Which AWS service or feature can help automate mitigation against these attacks?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Global reach

Selected Answer: C
For example, you can use AWS Global Accelerator to onboard traffic onto the AWS global network as close to them as possible, using the AWS globally redundant network to help improve your application availability and performance.

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. "Go global in minutes – Easily deploy your application in multiple regions around the world with just a few clicks. This means you can provide lower latency and a better experience for your customers at minimal cost."
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html
A is the right answer Agility is the right answer.
